jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
As KAM Verticals you will be part of our B2B Mobile sales organization (MX) and responsible to drive growth through the development and expansion of customer and channel relationships in appointed market segments. The role of the KAM adds value to Samsung and to their customers by delivering a well-managed and growing business for the Dutch market space. The Samsung KAM B2B is responsible for driving yearly revenue targets and long-term revenue through different market segments.
Role and Responsibilities
Your responsibilities
As KAM Verticals your key responsibilities will include:
Development of existing Verticals Accounts: Build strong customer relationships (30% of time)
Ensure the right solutions and activities are provided to the accounts and act as the point of contact within the organization to feedback specific needs with regards to your accounts solutions needs.

Position Samsung KNOX (secure platform)
Inform our managed resellers on the complete propositions towards the verticals
Coordinate, prepare and compile bid submission documents in relation to tendering/bidding activities, tender questionnaires and pre-qualifications (if applicable)
Develop and maintain broad and deep customer partnerships that involve building relationships at the C- level and expanding relationships outside of IT
Set up technical solution sessions with customers in the appropriate verticals
Inform end customers by organizing quarterly roadmap sessions
Ownership of any issues and escalation
 
Acquisition of new Vertical Accounts: Identify and win new key Accounts (30% of time) 
Develop and build up new channel partners into Samsung’s strategic direction for dedicated verticals.
Identify and win new accounts that can help to increase coverage in the different market segments
Works with the rest of the Samsung B2B team (PM, channel, biddesk etc.) to offer the right solutions and help in the execution of the strategy
Develop the value proposition (KNOX) to different accounts
Built a strong ECO-system at Key Accounts
Close opportunities by continuously reinforcing business value
Ownership of the acquisition process for all new accounts
 
Achieve key business goals including revenue quotas and reporting (40% of time) 
Manage sales results, progress and forecast reporting for the product category
Create strategic and actionable account/vertical plans that define a clear growth strategy
Monitor and report per vertical sales
Develop and manage a healthy and predictable pipeline that includes qualified opportunities 
Research and share intelligence on customers and their respective markets with other members of the sales team and internally at Samsung
Coordinates demand generation activities and ensure proper allocation of sales qualified leads
Skills and Qualifications
Our new KAM Verticals recognize themselves in the following criteria:
5-8 years successful experience managing mobile solutions in a growing business.
Minimum of 5 years of selling in the appropriate verticals (such as industry, logistics and retail).
Experience working with senior and executive level management in top 500 accounts and the ability to map a customers’ business need to technology solutions.

Market knowledge and experience: understands the vertical business drivers including key behaviors and strategies to engage.
Vertical network at all level of the organizations from C level to IT heads. Strong understanding of their needs and business models and requirements. Knowledge of the partners active in a specific segment.
Experience driving opportunities, managing a sales pipeline and exceeding quota within nominated market segment.
Customer focus: demonstrates concern for meeting and exceeding needs of customers.
Teamwork: works collaboratively with others to achieve group goals.
Business acumen and agility: Ability to articulate the business value of Samsung B2B and position them in competitive scenarios.
Effective engagement & communication: effective time management, account management and communication skills.
 
Preferred Profile
As KAM Verticals you recognize yourself in the following profile:
You are innovative (we move fast and take big risks).
You are passionate (we reveal in what we do).
You are collaborative (we recognize that we are all in this together).
You are strategic (think strategically and work operationally)
You are resilient (be personally involved but don’t take things personally)
You strive for excellence (premium brand with premium work and output)
You’re able to deal with ambiguity (with not all information available, still able to move ahead)

Competitive compensation & benefits package to reward you for your work in supporting our company to grow.

After more than 50 years, we are still innovating and creating boundless technology that helps people make the impossible possible. We remain driven by our purpose, which is why we put people and what they care about at the center of everything we create.

jobPostingInfo.title: Samsung Ads - Senior Machine Learning Engineer – Data Science
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Role and Responsibilities
Samsung Ads is an advanced advertising technology company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry’s most comprehensive data to build the world’s smartest advertising platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on the most challenging projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.
We are proud to have built a world-class organization grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.
At Samsung Ads, we are actively distilling the maximum value out of data to drive business growth and solve complex problems. We are exploring the latest data mining and machine learning techniques to form a data-driven culture for decision making and product design. As a data scientist of the Samsung Ads Platform Intelligence (PI) team, you will have access to unique Samsung proprietary data to address existing product challenges, uncover new revenue/profit opportunities, and build end-to-end solutions with real-world impact. You will work closely with different teams to develop insights and deliver end-to-end production solutions to effectively drive business and technical initiatives. You will also work with talented engineers and top-notch machine learning researchers on exciting projects and state-of-the-art technologies. You will be welcomed by a unique learning culture and creative work atmosphere. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to get deeply involved in envisioning, designing and implementing with a growing team.
Skills and Qualifications
Responsibilities
Lead a data science team to provide data-driven insights and deliver production-grade solutions to maximize the value of our data
Innovatively examine business health of and identify product bottlenecks in the entire Samsung Ads ecosystem to unveil new business opportunities, help strategic decision making and suggest technical solutions
Propose and deliver data science projects into production from end to end to drive business growth
Apply hands-on data science techniques, including advanced analytics, machine learning, statistics, etc. to solve challenging problems in a timely manner
Closely work with the machine learning team to define and improve machine learning products
Provide data science support to various stakeholders, for example, designing experiments and evaluation metrics for different products
Experience Requirements:
A Master’s degree with 2+ years of industry experience, or a PhD degree in science or engineering fields
Solid theoretical background in data analytics, data mining, machine learning, and statistics
Outstanding problem-solving skills and creative thinking to address open challenges in various fields
Proficiency in SQL and databases
Strong programming skills in Python, GO or other OOP languages
Experience with mainstream big data tools (e.g., Spark) and ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark ML, etc.)
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Preferred Experience Requirements:
Hands-on experience with production-grade machine learning solutions and/or software development
Experience with the advertising industry and real-time bidding (RTB) ecosystem
Effectively communicate with and present to a variety of audiences, such as the leadership team, engineering stakeholders, and product owners
Promote a data-driven culture within the company by coaching different stakeholders
Compensation for this role, for candidates based, is expected to be between $230,000 and $280,000.  Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.
Regular full-time employees (salaried or hourly) have access to benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Employee Purchase Program, Tuition Assistance (after 6 months), Paid Time Off, Student Loan Program (after 6 months), Wellness Incentives, and many more.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Why join our team?
The Sell Out Innovation Manager sits within the E-store team where the main focus is on direct to consumer – Samsung.com, Shop App, EPP, SMB, E-promoter and Samsung Experience Stores with the goal to improve the revenue contribution in these channels as well as great customer experience! 
This role reports to the Head of Demand Generation and the team has experienced much success in recent times delivering incremental revenue by launching promotional events from 2020-present. 
The demand generation team look after all promotional activity and sales innovation for Europe! Including:
•	Cross-category direct-to-consumer promotional campaigns (Samsung Festival)
•	Campaign optimisations
•	Sales channel exclusive promotions 
•	Promotional innovation pilots
Role and Responsibilities
Your key responsibilities
The Sell Out Innovation Manager, will work to explore, develop, validate, and deploy the growth of new innovative marketing and commerce solutions for the European region. You will be one of the key points of contact and work with subsidiary, EO and HQ teams to communicate the e-store team’s objectives and gain agreement. The role will lead the communications strategy and execution (written and orally) to our senior leaders to ensure full understanding and alignment of plans.
You will work on new projects and guide the solution-development through the lifecycle process across all existing and new European sites, focusing on driving incremental revenue for Samsung Europe. This could be piloting a new promotional mechanic or developing a new Pan-European promotional campaign.
THE CORE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
Work across a team of cross-functional business stakeholders, technology developers and agency partners to look at business opportunities and deliver revenue growth and innovation pilots/projects
Work with the CMI team to understand difficulties and solutions to critical business problems and identify key trends within the market that we need to capitalise on.
Undertake fact-finding work in support of technology product development or system changes to help drive innovative solutions that will drive incremental revenue.
Develop cases to show business and consumer benefits to achieve sign off from key senior leaders.
Collaborate with the Business Analyst to help investigate feasibility and scope of the projects, and potential innovative solutions.
Aid in the development and delivery of new processes, practices and structures to ensure standard methodology is adopted for internal team members and partners, including effective communication with the subsidiaries for any business transformation changes.
Lead (on behalf of e-store team leadership e.g SOI Director) on communications with HQ, EO and subsidiary management to ensure that all messages are landed appropriately and clearly. Where required, you will have to influence to ensure pan European initiatives (sponsored by EO leadership) are adopted enthusiastically and gain the required focus and support from all areas.
Support on commercial Pan-European campaign toolkits and rollout with 17 European subsidiaries
Skills and Qualifications
What we need for this role
To be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:
-  Ability to see the bigger picture and think strategically about what is possible. Take inspiration from other brands/sectors and be able to translate into Samsung world
-  Experience in a commercial e-commerce role is highly desirable
-  Excellent design skills of Powerpoint (and other programs) presentations to appeal to Samsung Senior Leadership teams – HQ, EO and subsidiaries. The ability to present in a format that is appealing and can be easily understood
Ability to prioritise and influence– projects, deliverables, and collaborators.
Excellent understanding of business complexity and project interdependencies
Ability to adapt quickly to changing business requirements
Hands on mentality and experience within delivery
Understanding of and/or experience with Korean culture desirable
Hard-working and upbeat when delivering multiple projects at the same time.
What does success look like?
The successful candidate will need to deliver best-in-class delivery of all demand generation promotional events according to the promotional calendar. They should meet all deadlines from initial briefing through to toolkit delivery and campaign execution.
Each event will need to achieve the pre-agreed KPIs, required outcomes and benefits (no. of subsidiaries taking part, incremental revenue, customer experience etc…)
Benefits of working here at Samsung include:
Hybrid working (3 days office & 2 days at home)
Bonus Scheme
Pension contribution
3 x volunteering days each year
Holiday - 25 days per annum plus bank holidays and an additional day off for your birthday!
Access to staff sales discounts on a wide range of Samsung products
Access to discount shopping portal

Position Summary
Samsung Ads is an advanced advertising technology company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling advertisers to connect audiences from Samsung devices as they are exposed to digital media, using the industry’s most comprehensive data to build the world’s smartest advertising platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on big, complex projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.
 
We are proud to have built a world-class organization grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. Machine learning lies at the core of the advertising industry, and this is no exception to Samsung Ads. At Samsung Ads, we are actively exploring the latest machine learning techniques to improve our existing systems and products and create new revenue streams. As a machine learning model engineer of the Samsung Ads Platform Intelligence (PI) team, you will have access to unique Samsung proprietary data to develop and deploy a wide spectrum of large-scale machine learning products with real-world impact. You will work closely with and be supported by a talented engineering team and top-notch researchers to work on exciting machine learning projects and state-of-the-art technologies. You will be welcomed by a unique learning culture and creative work atmosphere. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to get deeply involved in envisioning, designing and implementing cutting-edge machine learning products with a fast growing team.
This position will be working on the mobile performance ads product, which is one of the most interesting but challenging machine learning products.
Role and Responsibilities
A tech lead role to lead and deliver production-grade machine learning products from end to end to make Samsung Ads a key player in the mobile performance ads market.
Design, develop and deploy state-of-the-art and scalable machine learning models to achieve different optimization goals (e.g., app-install optimization, ROAS optimization, retention, etc.).
Research the latest machine learning technologies and keep up-to-date with industry trends and developments.
Analyze complex problems with massive advertising data, identify gaps, and propose and execute technical proposals.
Create prototypes of new ML-based solutions quickly and put them into production.
Closely work with different internal ML teams (e.g., ML platform, ML serving, and MLOps teams) to improve our codebase and product health.
Closely work with cross-functional partner teams in global settings to deliver new ML features and solutions and achieve business objectives.
Mentor junior engineers and provide technical guidance.
Learn quickly and adapt to a fast-paced working environment.
Skills and Qualifications
Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science or related fields (e.g., Mathematics).
5+ years of industry experience with a Master’s degree or 3+ years of industry experience with a PhD degree.
Solid theoretical background in machine learning and/or data mining.
Proficiency in mainstream ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark ML, etc.).
Hands-on experience with production-grade machine learning solutions.
Experience with mainstream big data tools (e.g., MapReduce, Spark, Flink, Kafka, etc.).
Extensive programming experience in Python, Go or other OOP languages.
Familiarity with data structures, algorithms and software engineering principles.
Proficiency in SQL and databases.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to drive cross-functional partnerships.
Preferred Experience Requirements:
Publications in top relevant venues (e.g., TPAMI, NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, KDD, WWW, SIGIR, AAAI, IJCAI, etc.).
Basic knowledge about Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Experience with the advertising industry and real-time bidding (RTB) ecosystem.
MOUNTAIN VIEW, CA AND NEW YORK, NY ONLY

Position Summary
Position Summary
Samsung Ads is an advanced advertising technology company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry’s most comprehensive data to build the world’s smartest advertising platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business worldwide means that we get to work on the most challenging projects with stakeholders and teams around the globe.
 
We are proud to have built a world-class organization grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.
 
Machine learning lies at the core of the advertising industry. This is no exception to Samsung Ads. At Samsung Ads, we actively explore the latest machine learning techniques to improve our existing systems and products and create new revenue streams. As a machine learning model engineer of the Samsung Ads Platform Intelligence (PI) team, you will have access to unique Samsung proprietary data to develop and deploy a wide spectrum of large-scale machine learning products with real-world impact. You will work closely with and be supported by a talented engineering team and top-notch researchers to work on exciting machine learning projects and state-of-the-art technologies. A unique learning culture and creative work atmosphere will welcome you. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to get deeply involved in envisioning, designing, and implementing cutting-edge machine learning products with a growing team.
Role and Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Lead a team to deliver production-grade machine learning solutions with notable business impact from end to end
Design, develop, and deploy scalable low-latency machine learning products
Communicate with various stakeholders to understand business requirements, manage expectations, and create effective roadmaps
Closely work with machine learning platform and serving teams to deploy and streamline machine learning pipelines
Optimize and scale up existing machine learning products
Closely work with the MLOps team to ensure product health
Closely work with external partners to introduce new machine learning features and tools
Research the latest machine learning technologies and keep up-to-date with industry trends and developments
Create quick prototypes and proof-of-concepts for new features
Design and implement next-generation machine learning models with advanced technologies
Skills and Qualifications
Experience Requirements:
Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science or related fields
5+ years of industry experience with a Master’s degree or 3+ years of industry experience with a PhD degree
Solid theoretical background in machine learning and/or data mining
Rich hands-on experience with production-grade machine learning solutions
Proficiency in mainstream ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark ML, etc.)
Experience with mainstream big data tools (e.g., MapReduce, Spark, Flink, Kafka, etc.)
Extensive programming experience in Python, Go, or other OOP languages
Familiarity with data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles
Proficiency in SQL and databases
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to drive cross-functional partnerships
Preferred Experience Requirements:
Publications in top relevant venues (e.g., TPAMI, NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, KDD, WWW, AAAI, IJCAI, etc.)
Basic knowledge about Amazon Web Services (AWS)
Experience with the advertising industry and real-time bidding (RTB) ecosystem
CALIFORNIA ONLY

Role and Responsibilities
As a GPU Command Processor FW Engineer, you will work as part of the GPU RTL CP team as an individual contributor. You primary responsibility will include, but not be limited to, GPU cluster control specification and Firmware implementation for industry-leading GPU hardware IP.
You work with the Arch/SW teams to develop GPU Command Processor to meet feature functionality and PPA metrics.
You collaborate with Arch/SW/PPA team to identify and solve performance bottlenecks, power/area inefficiency issues.
You analyze and influence future GPU architectures with RISC-V micro-processor.
You’re involved in delivering best in class GPU IP for mobile, laptop and automotive applications.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Role and Responsibilities
Role and Responsibilities
Samsung Ads is an advanced advertising technology company that is rapidly growing and focuses on enabling advertisers to connect with audiences from Samsung devices as they are exposed to digital media. It uses the industry’s most comprehensive data to build the world’s smartest advertising platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business worldwide means that we get to work on big, complex projects with stakeholders and teams around the globe.
We are proud to have built a world-class organization grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.
Machine learning lies at the core of the advertising industry, and this is no exception to Samsung Ads. At Samsung Ads, we actively explore the latest machine-learning techniques to improve our existing systems and products and create new revenue streams. As a machine learning platform engineer of the Samsung Ads Platform Intelligence (PI) team, you will have access to unique Samsung proprietary data to develop and deploy a wide spectrum of large-scale machine learning products with real-world impact. You will work closely with and be supported by a talented engineering team and top-notch researchers to work on exciting machine learning projects and state-of-the-art technologies. You will be welcomed by a unique learning culture and creative work atmosphere. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to get deeply involved in envisioning, designing, and implementing cutting-edge machine learning products with a fast-growing team.
Responsibilities
Design and develop the next-generation machine learning platform to support thousands of model training pipelines concurrently and trillions of daily batch predictions.
Build a world-class ML platform tailored for Samsung’s ML-based advertising business, which can significantly improve the lead time for the model's end-to-end development and deployment process.
Research the industry's latest machine learning platform technologies and create quick prototypes / proof-of-concepts.
We will work closely with internal ML teams (e.g., ML serving and MLOps teams) to improve the health of our codebase product and ensure the highest engineering quality.
Closely work with cross-functional partner teams in global settings to deliver new ML features and solutions and achieve business objectives.
Mentor junior engineers and provide technical guidance.
Learn quickly and adapt to a fast-paced working environment.
Skills And Qualifications
Experience Requirements
6+ years of industry experience with a Master's degree or 3+ years of industry experience with a PhD degree.
Having extensive industry experience with Infrastructure such as Code (Terraform), orchestration tools ( Airflow, AWS Step/Lambda), building CI/CD pipelines using GitHub Actions, and real-time monitoring/alerting frameworks such as Prometheus and Grafana.
Familiarity with CI/CD, ETL, big data tools, and mainstream ML libraries (e.g., MapReduce, Spark, Flink, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark ML, etc.).
Hands-on experience with machine learning-related frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, model registry, OpenMetadata, ML feature store).
Solid theoretical background in machine learning or data mining and strong conceptual, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
Extensive programming experience in Python, Go or other OOP languages, SQL and database, and familiarity with data structures, algorithms, and software engineering principles.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to drive cross-functional partnerships.
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, quickly debug issues, provide proof-of-concept solutions, and apply the changes to production.
Preferred Experience Requirements
Extensive experience with Snowflake, Snowpark, and Redis/Aerospike.
Knowledge about Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Experience with the advertising industry and real-time bidding (RTB) ecosystem
The salary range for this role, for candidates based in California, is expected to be between $230,000 and $270,000. Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
As the Digital Marketing Strategy and Creatives Head, your role is pivotal in driving Samsung's digital marketing efforts in the Southeast Asia and Oceania (SEAO) region. 
Reporting directly to the Head of Digital Marketing, you will lead a team responsible for crafting and executing innovative digital strategies that enhance customer engagement, loyalty, and revenue. Drawing insights from our consumers and external industry players, you will define the strategic roadmap for digital marketing excellence, elevating our Paid and Owned Marketing approaches.
Role and Responsibilities
Strategic Leadership and Planning (15%)
Develop and execute comprehensive digital marketing strategies tailored to the SEAO region, leveraging industry trends, consumer behaviors, and competitive insights.
Lead the exploration of emerging communication platforms and consumer trends to identify opportunities for differentiation and innovation.
Define audience segmentations, communication strategies, and contact plans to personalize marketing communications and optimize customer engagement.
Present strategic recommendations, market insights, and competitive analyses to senior leadership, guiding decision-making and resource allocation.
Lead and inspire a high-performing team, fostering innovation, collaboration, and accountability.
Define team members' goals and career development plans, mentoring and empowering them to maximize their potential and drive impactful results.
Provide comprehensive business and team reports to drive transparency and accountability.
Multichannel Marketing Strategy and Execution (15%)
Develop and implement multichannel marketing strategies to enhance customer engagement and drive brand awareness across various touchpoints, with a focus on CRM and direct marketing channels.
Drive regional cross-business unit campaign initiatives, ensuring cohesive execution and maximizing campaign effectiveness.
Direct and collaborate with agency creative and content teams to develop compelling campaign assets tailored to different channels and audience segments.
Implement data-driven approaches to personalize marketing communications and improve customer retention and loyalty.
Data Marketing and CRM Strategy (30%)
Develop and execute 1P audience strategy and plan, defining target audiences and segmentation strategies for effective acquisition and retention.
Lead strategy and creative brief development, consolidating feedback from subsidiaries and regional teams, ensuring consistent execution by agencies.
Oversee CRM creative development and publishing, aligning with brand guidelines and campaign objectives to enhance customer engagement and loyalty.
Manage market calendar planning and coordination with internal and external stakeholders, optimizing campaign performance across channels.
Facilitate communication between regional and global teams, ensuring alignment with overarching strategies and objectives.
Provide monthly market governance support, disseminating RHQ monthly calendar to subsidiaries, ensuring alignment with regional priorities for effective strategic initiatives.
Develop and execute data-driven marketing strategies, leading integrated campaigns aligned with brand objectives and customer insights.
Drive owned and paid CRM strategies, overseeing consistent execution across touchpoints to enhance customer experiences and interactions.
Optimize campaign performance through market calendar planning, ensuring alignment with business objectives and regional priorities.
Loyalty Programme and Community Activation (20%)
Plan, design, and oversee the implementation of an overarching brand loyalty strategy to increase customer engagement, boost retention, and maximize sales
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure cohesive integration of marketing efforts with business objectives and sales programmes.
Manage Samsung Rewards and Members Store marketing activities, driving engagement and participation through targeted campaigns and promotions.
Lead loyalty programs and Post Purchase Experience strategies, defining content strategies, and overseeing the creative publishing and copy writing process.
Drive community activation efforts to engage members and drive brand advocacy.
Campaign Oversight and Performance Analysis (10%)
Monitor campaign performance and conduct post-campaign analysis to evaluate effectiveness and ROI.
Derive actionable insights to optimize future campaigns and improve overall performance.
Collaborate with the Performance and Operations Lead to ensure seamless execution and alignment with business objectives.
Team and Stakeholder Management (10%)
Team reporting and Budget Management.
Prepare strategic business reporting decks, present strategy proposals & campaign plans to stakeholders, gaining buy-in alignment.
Manage stakeholder expectations and provide regular updates on campaign performance and strategic initiatives and project progress
Strict management of team budget and maintain strong vendor performance/relationships.
Ensure compliance with Samsung finance processes and timelines.
Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field required; MBA or advanced degree preferred.
Minimum of 8-10 years of experience in marketing strategy, planning, or related role.
Experience in digital marketing and familiarity with CRM channels is a plus.
Strong project management skills and proficiency in marketing analytics tools.
Ability to travel regionally and at short notice, as needed.
Competencies Required
Independent and Strategic Thinking:  
Self driven, highly responsible with ability to develop and execute strategic marketing plans aligned with business objectives, drawing insights from top industry players to drive digital marketing strategies.
Market Analysis
: Proficiency in conducting comprehensive market research and analysis to identify growth opportunities, market trends, and consumer insights, informing strategic decision-making.
Campaign Development: 
Experience in developing integrated marketing campaigns across various channels and platforms, ensuring alignment with brand objectives and audience preferences.
Audience Segmentation Expertise
: Familiarity with audience segmentation and a passion for understanding consumer insights, translating them into actionable business ideas to drive campaign effectiveness.
Performance Analysis: 
Strong analytical skills to monitor campaign performance, derive actionable insights, and optimize strategies for maximum impact, utilizing advanced analytics tools and methodologies.
Leadership: 
Proven leadership skills to inspire and empower teams, fostering collaboration, innovation, and accountability in driving digital marketing initiatives. Ability to determine and provide clear direction amidst ambiguity
Communication: 
Excellent communication and presentation skills to articulate complex ideas, gain stakeholder buy-in, and effectively convey marketing strategies and campaign outcomes
.
Collaboration: 
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and external partners to achieve shared goals, fostering a culture of teamwork and alignment in executing digital marketing strategies.
Adaptability: 
Flexibility to adapt to changing market dynamics, consumer behaviors, and business priorities, adjusting digital marketing strategies accordingly to drive success.
Problem-solving: 
Strong problem-solving skills to address challenges, identify opportunities for improvement, and drive continuous optimization of digital marketing initiatives.
Creativity
: Innovative thinking to develop creative and impactful marketing strategies and campaigns, inspired by emerging trends and innovative approaches in the digital marketing landscape.

jobPostingInfo.title: Regional Product Marketing - Home Appliance
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Join Samsung FLIP (Future Leaders Integrated Program)
Are you a recent graduate with passion for product marketing? Samsung’s Regional Office in Singapore is looking for talented individuals to join Samsung FLIP - Future Leaders Integrated Program and become the next generation of leaders in our Company.
About Samsung FLIP:
Samsung Future Leaders Integrated Program (FLIP), is your gateway to a dynamic career in one of the world's leading technology companies. Designed for graduates from top Singaporean universities, FLIP offers a unique opportunity to dive into the heart of Samsung's operations, gain invaluable experience, and fast-track your career growth. Join FLIP and become part of a vibrant community of future leaders shaping the future of technology.
Role and Responsibilities
Key Responsibilities:
As part of Regional Product Marketing Team for Digital Appliances (DA), you will undertake the responsibility to accelerate the development of the Small Digital Appliances business within SEAO region. They will undertake the responsibility to strengthen our market share positions and deliver improved revenue/profits for the category.
Job Description:
Translate the voice of customers, market research and other relevant market information into go-to-market strategies and plans that will provide differentiation for a relatively new entrant. 
Determine and champion support for the roadmap, resources, and infrastructure to enable our healthy and profitable growth for the next 3-5 years. 
Jump-start the start-up of our Small Digital Appliances business in markets where we are currently not participating actively. 
Improve our win-rate amongst subsidiaries by optimizing our positioning, portfolio/services, and business models in the marketplace. 
Ensure potential risks to sales achievement are mitigated. 
Establish relationships with decision makers across countries to navigate the possibly complex and long sales cycles. 
Plan and deliver relevant programs that will heighten the appeal of our products/services to key stakeholders. 
Perform competitive analysis of current offerings, using internal and external secondary, as well as hands-on primary research. 
Work with GBM to deliver a portfolio of products and solutions that provide competitive edge. 
Complete ROI calculations and revenue forecasts for future products, monitor performance and make adjustments to product plans based on results. 
Provide the necessary training with support from HQ to sustain the caliber of team members, as well as, strengthen the capabilities of our partners.
Skills and Qualifications
What We Offer:
Specialized Product Marketing Track
: Dive deep into the world of product management through targeted training, mentorship, and hands-on experience working on Samsung's innovative product portfolio, from our innovative mobile devices to our home appliances and device solutions.
Cross-Functional Exposure
: Gain insights into various facets of Samsung's business operations through collaboration assignments, providing you with a holistic understanding of product development, marketing, sales, and more.
Mentorship and Guidance
: Learn from seasoned sales and product management professionals who will serve as mentors, offering invaluable insights and support as you navigate your career path.
Real-World Projects:
 Work on challenging projects that allow you to apply your skills and creativity to drive product innovation and meet market demands.
Networking Opportunities
: Collaborate with cross-functional teams and build a strong network of peers and mentors within Samsung's global ecosystem.
Career Development
: Access to tailored training programs, workshops, and resources to accelerate your growth and advance your career in product management.
Post-Program Placement:
 Upon successful completion of the 2-year program, you will have the opportunity to be assigned as a Product Marketing personnel in one of Samsung's emerging Southeast Asia Oceania subsidiaries (Vietnam, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia, Philippines). This placement offers a unique opportunity to apply your skills and expertise in a dynamic market, contributing to Samsung's growth and success in the region.
Who We're Looking For:
Recent graduates from Singapore's top universities with a passion for technology and innovation, Fresh graduates and 1-2 year experienced candidates are welcome to apply
Demonstrated academic excellence and leadership potential.
Interest in marketing / brand management field
Strong analytical skills and the ability to think critically and creatively.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Staff Engineer to join our Samsung Ads team. As a Staff Engineer on our Backend Ad Serving Team you will be responsible for designing backend ad serving and creative selection modules, as well as maintaining the components that are developed as part of the software development lifecycle predominantly leveraging the Go programming language. Your expertise will play a crucial role in driving the success of our advertising technology, helping us efficiently deliver the right ads to the right user. If this sounds like you, please read on!
Role and Responsibilities
Over the last few years, Samsung has been investing in building a portfolio of engaging services across its devices to complement its market-leading hardware business, while leveraging its unparalleled global distribution footprint. These services, coupled with a vast partner network and proprietary data, generate a massive opportunity for ad-based monetization. Six years into this journey, Samsung Ads is a highly successful and fast-growing business. This business and its continued future success depend on the products, technologies, and tools owned by the Global Ads Product & Engineering team. Hundreds of people strong, with a substantial presence in five countries, the Global Ads P&E team is a dynamic and complex organization, operating across a broad spectrum of product and strategic domains. 
Responsibilities
Design and develop ad serving software using the Go programming language, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability in the system
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, data scientists, and other engineers, to define requirements and deliver innovative ad tech solutions
Optimize ad delivery algorithms and infrastructure to ensure efficient utilization of resources and minimal latency
Developing a bitflow for native TV ad experience
Build monitoring and analytics tools to track ad performance, user engagement, and system health, providing insights to improve our ad serving capabilities
Lead and mentor junior engineers, fostering a culture of learning and collaboration within the team
Stay updated with the latest developments in ad tech and contribute to the continuous improvement of our systems through research and innovation
Participate in code reviews, architectural discussions, and technical decision-making processes
Skills and Qualifications
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
At least eight years of proven experience as a Software Engineer, with a significant focus on developing ad tech or ad-serving platforms with high-impact
Strong problem-solving skills and a track record of delivering high-quality, scalable software
Strong expertise in Go programming language (Golang) and proficiency in concurrent programming
Proven experience with developing ad tech or ad serving platforms with high impact
Knowledge of ad tech protocols and standards (e.g., OpenRTB, VAST, VPAID) is a plus
Experience with distributed systems, microservices architecture, and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)
Familiarity with data stores and databases, such as SQL and NoSQL databases
Ability to troubleshoot and optimize performance bottlenecks in large-scale systems
Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment
Join our dynamic team and play a key role in shaping the future of our ad tech platform. If you're passionate about building cutting-edge advertising solutions and have a solid background in Go development, we would love to hear from you!
CALIFORNIA ONLY
Compensation for this role is expected to be between $200,000 and $245,000. Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Samsung TV Plus is an industry-leading FAST (free ad-supported TV) and VOD (video-on-demand) service reaching 24 countries and millions of devices globally across TV and mobile.  One of the first FAST platforms, Samsung TV Plus now offers more than 250 channels in the U.S. and nearly 2,000 channels globally, along with thousands of shows and movies on-demand.  FAST is the fastest-growing video segment among consumers and FAST ad spend is expected to surpass that of Broadcast/Cable (combined) and SVOD within the next three years.  This role offers the opportunity to work at the forefront of the exploding and ever-evolving FAST space and play a key role in driving the growth of the TV Plus business.
Samsung TV Plus is seeking a Senior Technical Project Manager, who will report into the Head of Project Management Office and be responsible to lead and execute on key technical initiatives across Content Recommendations, Infrastructure, and Platform teams in a way that enables the business to launch and scale new content and product offerings. This is an individual contributor role, with growth path to developing into a manager position in the long term.
Role and Responsibilities
Manage cross functional communication across technical and business teams, both upstream and downstream of service value chain.
Monitor key quality metrics, define and implement initiatives to drive process improvements on technical projects.
Develop and implement best practices for deployment of new product features and content offerings.
Work directly with external providers, customers, and partner teams to craft and deliver implementation of scalable solutions.
Partner with other managers to secure resources, scope efforts, set project priorities and milestones and drive delivery.
Own project updates, accelerating progress by driving crisp and timely decisions, clearing blockers (e.g., path to green), escalating as appropriate, and sending newsletters.
Develop, implement, and govern KPI reporting for a portfolio of projects, providing visibility to the milestones, and performance across all projects and using data to drive/influence business decisions.
Manage post-launch support plans and look for opportunities to improve program quality and operational excellence.
Skills and Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:
 
5+ years of technical project management experience working closely with Product and Engineering.
Experience using data and metrics to determine and drive improvements.
Experience owning project strategy, end to end delivery, and communicating results to senior leadership.
Bachelor's degree.
Experience with jira, confluence, agile, and other project management disciplines and tools.
Ability to thrive in an ambiguous environment and adjust priorities accordingly.
Preferred Qualifications:
 
2+ years of driving and scaling technical projects with Engineering and Product teams.
Master's degree, or MBA.
Experience in Entertainment/ Streaming, Ad Tech/ Big Tech.
Compensation for this role, for candidates based in Mountain View, CA, is expected to be between $160,000 ~ $195,000.  Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.
Regular full-time employees (salaried or hourly) have access to benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Employee Purchase Program, Tuition Assistance (after 6 months), Paid Time Off, Student Loan Program (after 6 months), Wellness Incentives, and many more.

jobPostingInfo.title: Sr. DFT/MBIST Engineer
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Samsung, a world leader in advanced semiconductor technology, is founded on a simple philosophy – the endless pursuit of excellence will create a better world for all. At Samsung Austin Research and Development Center (SARC) and Advanced Computing Lab (ACL), we are building a center of excellence for Intellectual Property (IP) that is applied to high-performance computing devices (mobile, automotive, and other custom market segments) consumed by millions of people around the world. Come build with us!
Role and Responsibilities
The Senior DFT/MBIST Engineer is responsible for designing and implementing Memory Built-in Self Test (MBIST) solutions across a variety of digital IP (CPU/GPU) and SOC projects. You will work closely with stakeholders to define MBIST architectures, create implementation specifications, implement MBIST solutions in RTL and generate high quality patterns. You will also be responsible for ensuring high test-coverage, minimizing test-time, and exploring tools/methods to improve execution efficiency. Finally, you will collaborate closely with SOC and Product/Test Engineering teams to quickly resolve silicon issues. This position is located in Austin, TX.
You understand SOC requirements and project milestones to define a DFT architecture that optimally balances coverage, test-time, and execution.
You create a detailed implementation spec that documents MBIST architecture details such as SOC-level interface, clock design, memory load/dump debug interface, Power on MBIST self-test, among others.
You close on the spec with stakeholders including DFX/RTL/SOC/STA/PD teams.
You implement MBIST: RTL insertion, LINT, timing-constraints, MBIST pattern generation, logic to maximize scan coverage of memory, and interface with MBIST.
You implement MBIST with power and physical considerations in mind.
You drive towards DFX excellence: improving test-coverage, minimizing test-time, and exploring tools/methods that improve execution efficiency.
You build strong collaboration with SOC and Product/Test Engineering teams to quickly resolve silicon issues including test-escapes and yield loss.
Skills and Qualifications
15+ years of experience with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or 13+ years of experience with a Master’s Degree, or 11+ years of experience with a PhD
10+ years of DFT/MBIST expertise encompassing multiple tapeouts for digital IP (CPU/GPU) and/or SOC projects.
Demonstrated ability to architect MBIST solutions from scratch on at least 1 project, and to create detailed specifications that can be used as a blueprint for implementation.
Detailed understanding of MBIST test requirements and implementation.
Experience with Siemens MBIST solutions/Tessent MemoryBIST or comparable is required.
Strong familiarity with RTL coding & STA, with working knowledge of Physical Design.
Exposure to advanced approaches such as hierarchical DFT.
Strong post-silicon experience in debugging silicon behavior and test-escape issues.
Familiarity with multi-voltage and multi-clocking domain implementation is a plus.
Ability to solve difficult problems with creative solutions or analysis.
Crisp written and oral communication skills including working with global stakeholders.
Thrives in a fast-paced environment: i.e., yearly project tapeouts.
Our Team
We’re strengthening our team of talented individuals with diverse skill sets to build a technology roadmap and deliver market-leading GPU. Our Xclipse GPU is the first mobile GPU with ray tracing technology that enables console-level graphic for Samsung Galaxy smartphones. With architecture scalability at the frontier of our design focus, our performance- and power-optimized IP solution gets integrated into complex semiconductor products, aiming to reach multiple market segments.
Our Physical Design group is part of the larger Design Implementation team at SARC/ACL. The fast-paced environment here provides us opportunities to learn different areas of design implementation and diversifying our technical expertise. We take pride in our highly collaborative team culture and feel supported by our leadership to explore new ideas and bring them to reality everyday. We believe in connecting your area of expertise with the right level and functional discipline that can empower you to grow.
Total Rewards
At Samsung – SARC/ACL, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $174,557 and $270,563. Your actual base pay will depend on variables that may include your education skills, qualifications, experience, and work location.
Samsung employees have access to benefits including: medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), free onsite lunch, employee purchase program, tuition assistance (after 6 months), paid time off, student loan program, wellness incentives, and many more. In addition, regular full-time employees (salaried or hourly) are eligible for MBO bonus compensation, based on company, division, and individual performance.
Additionally, this role might be eligible to participate in long term incentive plan and relocation.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Role and Responsibilities
Samsung has developed a proprietary ad platform that leverages unique first party TV data to help brands connect to their audience as they explore content across desktop, mobile, tablets and our SMART TVs. Additionally, Samsung TV Plus is one of the largest and most quickly growing free, ad-supported TV (FAST) services in the US. The Samsung Ad Platform delivers high-quality audience targeting powered by three key components: a highly engaged streaming video viewer, first-party audience data at scale, and world-class data science.
We are currently looking for a talented account executive focused on growing revenue and building new relationships with performance driven agencies and advertisers in the Mobile Space. Performance Sales is one of Samsung Ads’ fastest growing customer categories and is inclusive of many national and regional advertisers- many are brand new to the medium. The ideal candidate should have a passion for mobile advertising, expertise in data driven audience activation, and a pulse on new multi-channel advertising technologies. This individual must be able to think strategically, anticipate how buying decisions are made, uncover the business needs of key clients and have a proven ability to close deals. Additionally, this sales executive will be the consummate team-player and have the ability to work collaboratively across the sales organization within a fluid and fast-paced environment.
This individual should have existing relationships across performance, direct response, and direct-to-consumer teams including key senior level contacts at agencies and brands. This account executive must be able to think strategically, anticipate how buying decisions are made, uncover the business needs of key clients, and have a proven ability to drive spend through Programmatic Guaranteed (PG), Private Marketplace (PMP), and Insertion Order (IO) buy types. This position will carry an annual revenue goal.
This Performance Seller position is based in New York with domestic US travel as needed, occasional visits to the product/engineering offices in Montreal, Canada and Mountain View, CA. You will report to our Performance Sales Lead. If you're interested in joining a rapidly growing team working to build a unique, world-class advertising sales organization with a relentless focus on data and customer experience, you've come to the right place.
As an individual contributor, you'll be supported by our world class ad operations team and will benefit from working with a leadership team that is chartering our explosive growth.
Responsibilities:
 
Actively drive revenue from performance advertisers and agencies to Samsung Ads mobile ad products across native and video (TV Plus)
Gather market intelligence from Performance Sales clients and share into the broader cross-functional organization – including HQ Mobile Ads teams – inclusive of trends and best practices to ensure continued innovation to meet changing marketplace needs (e.g. identity needs, inventory value)
Accurately forecast revenue, identify irregularities, and seek out opportunities for growth with competitive insight across assigned book of business
Actively communicate any meaningful product updates for Samsung Ads mobile ad products to assigned clients and return feedback to the organization on potential implications to each client’s business with Samsung
Collaborate with other members of the Performance Sales team as needed to help sell-through mobile ad products to as many Performance advertisers and agencies as possible
Build strong relationships with assigned performance advertisers and agencies
Develop a deep technical understanding of the Samsung Ads mobile platform, capabilities, and unique inventory (including Samsung TV Plus, Samsung News, and Samsung Game Launcher)
Continuously provide value to customers and serve as a trusted consultant to drive mobile advertising growth with Samsung Ads
Required Experience:
Deep understanding of the mobile media ecosystem
7+ years of industry or relatable experience with a significant portion spent working at a mobile app publisher or SSP
Proven track record of securing and growing spend from advertisers and agencies via all buy types: Programmatic Guaranteed (PG), Private Marketplace (PMP), and Insertion Order (IO)
Successful internal and external relationship management
Experience working in both entrepreneurial and established corporate cultures
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, strong attention to detail, and good follow-through
Talent at explaining complex topics in simple terms in person, over the phone or video conference
Bachelor's Degree; MBA or other advanced degree a plus
Preferred Experience
Experience in the performance, direct response, and direct-to-consumer space
Join the Best
We are looking for the best people. People who are prepared to dig in and live on the edge of a fast paced and rapidly evolving industry. 
When you look back on your career, do you want to be able to look at what you have accomplished and see that you had a major impact, in an industry that is transforming the way people live and work every day?  If so, then Samsung is the place for you.
The salary range for this role is expected to be between $150,000 and $175,000 plus bonus.  Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.

Hands on experience doing physical design and timing closure of complex blocks and full-chip designs.
Experience in top level floor planning including partition shaping and sizing, pin placement, channel planning, high speed signal and clock planning and feed-through planning is a plus.

Power user of industry standard tools (ICC/DC/PT/VSLP/Redhawk/Calibre/Formality) and able to understand their capabilities.

Familiar in hierarchical design, top-down design, budgeting, timing and physical convergence.
Good understanding of Physical Design Verification methodology to debug LVS/DRC issues at chip/block level.
Should have gone through recent successful SOC tape-outs.

jobPostingInfo.title: Director of Product, Measurement
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Samsung Ads is seeking a strategic and visionary Director of Product, Measurement to lead the development and scaling of its core measurement products. The ideal candidate will combine strategic insight, product management expertise, focused execution, and leadership skills to drive the success of measurement initiatives across platforms such as CTV, Native TV, DooH, and Mobile.
Role and Responsibilities
Develop and implement a multiyear vision and product roadmap for core measurement products, ensuring value delivery across Samsung Ads’ entire product suite.
Lead a focused, agile team within a matrixed organization, effectively balancing priorities to execute the product roadmap.
Create a forward-thinking portfolio that integrates both first-party (1P) and third-party (3P) measurement solutions.
Expand and enhance measurement and attribution products using first-party data for enterprise and mid-market clients globally.
Partner on developing third-party measurement products to meet advertisers’ KPIs for reach and performance, assess market trends, gather advertiser feedback, and conduct competitive analysis to develop cutting-edge products.
Collaborate with a diverse, cross-functional, distributed teams of Sales, BD, designers and engineers to define and build products. Work with go-to-market teams to iteratively launch solutions, ensuring the product vision and strategy are realized.
Build relationships with stakeholders, product leads, and owners in order to effectively advocate for your strategy.
Communicate strategy and vision effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Skills and Qualifications
Qualifications
At least 8 years in ad tech, with a minimum of 4 years focused on TV advertising data related to measurement and attribution
A minimum of 6 years in product management, with at least 3 years of experience in people management
Experience working collaboratively with remote, distributed teams
Demonstrated expertise and thought leadership in Performance and Reach measurement across media platforms
Proven ability to influence and align executive leadership across a diverse enterprise with varying levels of understanding
Demonstrated ability to lead in ambiguous situations, with strong strategic thinking and collaboration skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, highly independent environment, managing multiple projects, responsibilities, and relationships
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate and present to stakeholders at all levels of the business
Experience with experimental A/B testing and predictive modeling for measurement is a plus
Willingness to travel and ability to work independently
Salary Range Pay Transparency: 
Compensation for this role, for candidates based in Mountain View, CA, is expected to be between $200,000 and $250,000.  Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.
Regular full-time employees (salaried or hourly) have access to benefits including: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Employee Purchase Program, Tuition Assistance (after 6 months), Paid Time Off, Student Loan Program (after 6 months), Wellness Incentives, and many more.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Asap ou à partir du 02/09/2024
Saint-Ouen, 93
Samsung, une entreprise d’envergure internationale
Vous connaissez très certainement nos TV, nos Smartphones voire même notre électroménager, mais saviez-vous que Samsung est devenue l’une des 10 plus grandes et profitables entreprises au monde avec des activités allant de la technologie de pointe, des semi-conducteurs, à la construction d’usines et de gratte-ciel (Burj Khalifa ; Petronas Twin Towers), en passant par la pétrochimie, la mode, la médecine, la finance, l'hôtellerie et bien plus encore. Nos découvertes, nos inventions et nos produits révolutionnaires nous ont permis d'asseoir notre position de leader dans tous ces domaines, et de toujours aller de l’avant.
Votre opportunité 
Nous recherchons un apprenti pour rejoindre et renforcer notre équipe Consumer & Market Insights (CMI) et Data Analytics au sein du département Corporate Marketing. Le CMI a pour vocation à comprendre les utilisateurs de nos catégories de produits pour en tirer des insights, formuler des recommandations pour aider les différentes directions marketing, commerciales et média à prendre les bonnes décisions.
Role and Responsibilities
Vos responsabilités 
Mise en place de projets d’études consommateurs (étude de satisfaction, test publicitaires, baromètres de suivi de notoriété de la marque et des produits, test de concepts …) sur l’ensemble des produits de la marque.
Rédaction des questionnaires, traitement et analyse des données et participation à la rédaction de rapports de résultats
Assister le Consumer Insights Analyst Senior dans la conduite de projets d’études avec les instituts / agences
Veille des bonnes et nouvelles pratiques sur le marché des études
Veille des tendances sur l’Intelligence Artificielle et les produits technologiques
Skills and Qualifications
Profil recherché
Formation supérieure (grandes écoles de commerce, IAE avec spécialisation études de marché, études marketing, IEP)
Pré requis : connaissance des études marketing via une 1ère expérience réussie en stage au sein d’un institut/agence (Kantar, GfK, Nielsen, Ipsos…) ou chez l’annonceur comme assistant chargé d’études.
Expérience dans la gestion de la relation client / CRM est un plus.
Vous savez faire parler les chiffres et vous êtes reconnu(e) pour votre esprit d’analyse et de synthèse.
Forte sensibilité sur les produits électroniques (téléphones, PC, tablettes, TV, audio/vidéo…).
Bon niveau d’anglais à l’écrit et à l’oral (communication écrite et orale avec des interlocuteurs anglophones, capacité à rédiger en anglais des questionnaires et rapports d’analyse)
Organisé(e), capable de gérer simultanément plusieurs projets.
Rigoureux, curieux, débrouillard, esprit positif tourné vers la résolution de problèmes, goût pour le travail en équipe.
Pourquoi rejoindre Samsung ?
Nos 500.000 collaborateurs partagent une véritable culture du leadership, du challenge et de la réussite. Nos équipes sont aussi diversifiées et dynamiques que les produits que nous fabriquons et les marchés où nous sommes implantés.
Grâce à notre présence mondiale, nos téléphones, nos équipements multimédias et de loisirs améliorent la vie de nos clients sur toute la planète.
En rejoignant Samsung Electronics et notre capacité à anticiper les tendances, et même à en créer nous-mêmes, vous serez en prise directe avec le futur, à la pointe de la technologie la plus avancée.

jobPostingInfo.title: Director, Machine Learning Modeling
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Samsung Ads is an advanced advertising technology company that is rapidly growing and focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry’s most comprehensive data to build the world’s smartest advertising platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business worldwide means that we get to work on the most challenging projects with stakeholders and teams around the globe.
 
We are proud to have built a world-class organization grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.
 
Machine learning lies at the core of the advertising industry. This is no exception to Samsung Ads. At Samsung Ads, we actively explore the latest machine-learning techniques to improve our existing systems and products and create new revenue streams. As a machine learning model director of the Samsung Ads Platform Intelligence (PI) team, you will have access to unique Samsung proprietary data to develop and deploy a wide spectrum of large-scale machine learning products with real-world impact. You will work closely with and be supported by a talented engineering team and top-notch researchers to work on exciting machine learning projects and state-of-the-art technologies. You will be welcomed by a unique learning culture and creative work atmosphere. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to get deeply involved in envisioning, designing and implementing cutting-edge machine learning products with a growing team.
Location: Mountain View, CA
Role and Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Lead multiple global feature teams to deliver production-grade machine learning solutions with notable business impact from end to end
Establish a clear vision and executable strategies for different machine learning component teams
Take initiative to address technical challenges, tackle open problems, and advance the team’s machine learning capabilities

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Position Summary
Samsung Ads is an advanced advertising technology company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry’s most comprehensive data to build the world’s smartest advertising platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on the most challenging projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.
 
We are proud to have built a world-class organization grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.
 
Machine learning lies in the core of the advertising industry. This is no exception to Samsung Ads. At Samsung Ads, we are actively exploring the latest machine learning techniques to improve our existing systems and products and create new revenue streams. As a machine learning model engineer of the Samsung Ads Platform Intelligence (PI) team, you will have access to unique Samsung proprietary data to develop and deploy a wide spectrum of large-scale machine learning products with real-world impact. You will work closely with and be supported by a talented engineering team and top-notch researchers to work on exciting machine learning projects and state-of-the-art technologies. You will be welcomed by a unique learning culture and creative work atmosphere. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to get deeply involved in envisioning, designing and implementing cutting-edge machine learning products with a growing team.
Role and Responsibilities
Responsibilities
Deliver production-grade machine learning solutions
Design, develop and deploy scalable low-latency machine learning products
Communicate with various stakeholders to understand business requirements, manage expectations and create effective roadmaps
Closely work with machine learning platform and serving teams to deploy and streamline machine learning pipelines
Optimize and scale up existing machine learning products
Closely work with the MLOps team to ensure product health
Closely work with external partners to introduce new machine learning features and tools
Research the latest machine learning technologies and keep up-to-date with industry trends and developments
Create quick prototypes and proof-of-concepts for new features
Design and implement next-generation machine learning models with advanced technologies
Skills and Qualifications
Experience Requirements:
Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science or related fields
Minimum 2+ years of industry experience with a Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science or related fields such as Statistics, Data Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics  
Solid theoretical background in machine learning and/or data mining
Rich hands-on experience with production-grade machine learning solutions
Proficiency in mainstream ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark ML, etc.)
Experience with mainstream big data tools (e.g., MapReduce, Spark, Flink, Kafka, etc.)
Extensive programming experience in Python, Go or other OOP languages

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Create the unthinkable and #ReimagineYourFuture with Samsung, one of the most successful and fastest growing technology companies in the world. We are an extremely dynamic business, launching an incredible number and range of new products every year. We also firmly believe that our product ecosystem and portfolio of innovation set our brand apart.
This is an opportunity for you to join Samsung Australia and make a difference as our Logistics Costing Analyst Manager in the Logistics division. Are you ready to take charge of logistics cost management and drive financial efficiency in a dynamic environment? In this role you will oversee logistic costing, analysis, and a billing team, ensuring our operations are financially optimised and compliant.
In this crucial role, you'll prepare detailed performance reports, provide insightful variance analysis, and conduct cost analyses to identify savings opportunities. You'll collaborate with third-party logistics providers (3PLs) to meet KPIs and cost targets and lead the forecasting of logistics costs and revenue to achieve corporate financial goals.
Join us and make a significant impact on our logistics operations, driving cost efficiency and contributing to our overall success. If you’re a forward-thinking professional with a passion for logistics and financial management, we want to hear from you!
Role and Responsibilities
Performance Reporting:
Lead the preparation and distribution of performance reports to Finance, Logistics Managers, and Product Managers.
Provide timely and accurate monthly cost management and freight reports, including insightful variance analysis to inform decision-making.
Cost Analysis:
Conduct ongoing analysis of process constraints, target cost-saving projects, and trace costs back to underlying activities
Partner with 3PLs to ensure SOPs are followed while meeting KPIs and cost targets
Forecasting:
Prepare logistics cost and cost ratio forecasts, reviewing them with Finance monthly to ensure corporate finance targets are achieved
Conduct weekly and daily revenue forecasts, especially during the last week of the month, to ensure planned revenue targets are delivered
Ad-hoc Projects:
Undertake various ad-hoc projects, analysing and reporting on outcomes, and making recommendations for improvement.
Advise the Logistics Manager on matters requiring attention and implement decisions
Cost Efficiency:
Drive process and cost efficiency internally and with 3PL providers
Analyse and interpret various logistical data to identify trends and areas for improvement
Track and analyse the cost of poor quality (COPQ) at the product division level
GMP System Management:
Maintain LT/Cut-off/Holiday master data in GERP as per operational needs and seasonality
Monitor EDI daily to ensure errors are identified and resolved promptly
Manage the tariff system in GERP to ensure contract pricing structures adequately reflect logistics costing
System Support:
Maintain a comprehensive database of logistics information for accurate reporting and analysis and develop and implement ongoing system enhancements to improve functionality and efficiency
KPI Management:
Review and develop new logistics KPIs and KPI incentives with the Operations Manager to ensure performance targets are met
Team Development:
Mentor and develop team members to ensure task sustainability and promote professional growth
Foster team collaboration through backup plans and cohesive learning via Standard Operating Procedures and On-boarding Plans
Skills and Qualifications
Tertiary qualifications in Accounting & Finance is preferred and has a solid understanding of financial principles and practices in the context of logistics operations
A minimum of 5 years' experience in a similar role is required to demonstrate a deep understanding of logistics commercial management and financial analysis.
Proficiency in Credit Risk Analysis is necessary to assess and mitigate financial risks associated with logistics operations.
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain customer relations is crucial for fostering positive relationships with both internal teams and external partners.
Strong proficiency in SAP is highly desirable and experience in RFQ (Request for Quotation) preparation
Advanced MS Excel skills are essential for data analysis, financial reporting, and forecasting within the logistics context
Agility and adaptability to rapid changes are critical in the dynamic logistics environment, enabling proactive responses to evolving business needs and market trends
What sets us apart from the rest?
At the heart of our DNA is the pursuit of excellence and bringing innovation to everyone, faster than anyone. Join a talented team of energetic, passionate and hardworking people that are committed to the customer and delivering solid results. In return, we will give you the tools to help nourish your development, wellbeing and fast-track your career. When you work for Samsung Australia, you can look forward to:
Competitive remuneration package

Generous employee discount across our products
Ongoing professional development opportunities

Position Summary
Samsung, a world leader in advanced semiconductor technology, is founded on a simple philosophy – the endless pursuit of excellence will create a better world for all. At Samsung Austin Research and Development Center (SARC) and Advanced Computing Lab (ACL), we are building a center of excellence for Intellectual Property (IP) that is applied to high-performance computing devices (mobile, automotive, and other custom market segments) consumed by millions of people around the world. Come build with us!
Role and Responsibilities
As a GPU Modeling Engineer you will work as part of the GPU Hardware Modeling team, where you will be responsible for functional modeling of various blocks of the GPU pipeline. This is a mid- to senior-level role with responsibilities to include the following:
You interface with architects, RTL designers, verification engineers and software engineers to understand the GPU pipeline
You design and architect C++ models of a GPU blocks
You implement and test the GPU models
You identify architecture, micro-architecture, and implementation optimizations to improve the functionality and performance of the GPU and its units
Skills and Qualifications
10+ years of experience with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or 8+ years of experience with a Master’s Degree, or 6+ years of experience with a PhD
10+ years of experience in software design and architecture
Expertise in C++ programming, including STL, in a Linux environment
Deep understanding of GPU/CPU or computer architecture and micro-architecture concepts
Experience using development tools such as revision control systems, debuggers, and make/cmake
Hardware modeling experience, especially the Sparta Modeling Framework
Experience with performance profiling and analysis
Some familiarity with SystemVerilog is preferred
RTL verification experience is a plus
Our Team
We’re growing a team with talented individuals and diverse skillsets to build a technology roadmap and deliver market-leading GPU product. Our Xclipse GPU is the first mobile GPU with ray tracing technology that enables console-level graphic for Samsung Galaxy smartphones.
Being part of a unique growing team at a well-established global company means you have limitless room to explore, innovate, and grow by wearing different hats. Our GPU Architect team delivers whole system architecture-level design for Samsung’s current and next-generation mobile GPU. Depending on the functional discipline, they’re responsible for anywhere from early-stage architectural exploration, research work focusing on graphic and machine learning, defining new features, modeling, to diving into microarchitecture design and programming work.
Total Rewards
At Samsung – SARC/ACL, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. Additionally, this role might be eligible to participate in long term incentive plan and relocation.
