jobPostingInfo.title: GPU RTL Power Architect
jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Samsung, a world leader in advanced semiconductor technology, is founded on a simple philosophy – the endless pursuit of excellence will create a better world for all. At Samsung Austin Research and Development Center (SARC) and Advanced Computing Lab (ACL), we are building a center of excellence for Intellectual Property (IP) that is applied to high-performance computing devices (mobile, automotive, and other custom market segments) consumed by millions of people around the world. Come build with us!
Role and Responsibilities
As a GPU RTL Power Architect, you will work as part of the GPU RTL team where you will take ownership on optimizing power efficiency for our GPU blocks and subsystems that get integrated into premium smartphone and other adjacent market segments.
You are empowered to experiment with new ideas while contributing to Samsung’s current and next-generation mobile GPU architecture. You will explore deliverable options to improve power-efficiency of the design using architectural and/or micro-architectural techniques to optimize design capacitance/switching activity for a given workload, utilizing RTL coding techniques for low power, and analyzing performance bottlenecks to improve block resource utilization/energy-efficiency.
You are passionate about identifying and distilling complex problems or situations by seeking the root cause.
You collaborate with the RTL designers to implement power-efficient design practices from the ground up, ensuring that power constraints are met while maintaining high performance.
You conduct RTL power analysis using industry-standard tools to identify power-hungry areas, bottlenecks, and opportunities for improvement.
You perform detailed analysis of underlying RTL while executing relevant benchmarks or gaming workloads, estimating power impact of architecture/micro-arch/RTL features.
You enhance the microarchitecture/RTL to optimize power, improve energy efficiency, and maximize perf-per-watt
You define power-efficient microarchitectural choices and PPA optimizations
You identify and implement power-saving techniques such as clock gating, voltage scaling, and low-power modes, to minimize power consumption in GPU blocks and subsystems
You collaborate with cross-functional teams, including performance architects, modeling, design implementation, and validation teams, to understand design specifications and power requirements to ensure power-efficient designs align with performance goals
You maintain thorough documentation of power optimization strategies, results, and best practices, and communicate findings to relevant teams and stakeholders.
Skills and Qualifications
Minimum Requirements:
10+ years of experience with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or 8+ years of experience with a Master’s Degree, or 6+ years of experience with a PhD
Expertise in System-Verilog is required, as is a deep understanding of logic design and ASIC design flow including RTL design, verification, logic synthesis, timing analysis and power optimization
Proficiency in power analysis using industry-standard methodologies and power tools such as PowerArtist, PTPX, Empower, or equivalent
In-depth knowledge of GPU/CPU architecture, microarchitecture, and various digital sub-blocks
Experience with a scripting languages like Perl or Python
Understanding of overhead and benefit tradeoff for clock gating and power gating techniques
Familiarity with dynamic and leakage power tradeoff
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, along with the ability to work in a dynamic, global team
Experience in RTL design of various digital sub-blocks of GPU/CPU/high performance digital designs
Knowledge of low-power design techniques and methodologies
Familiarity with physical design flows, STA flows, and tools
Our Team
We’re growing a team of talented individuals with diverse skill sets to build a technology roadmap and deliver market-leading GPU. Our Xclipse GPU is the first mobile GPU with ray tracing technology that enables console-level graphic for Samsung Galaxy smartphones.

These services, coupled with a vast partner network and proprietary data, generate a massive opportunity for ad-based monetization. Six years into this journey, Samsung Ads is a highly successful and fast-growing business. This business and its continued future success depend on the products, technologies, and tools owned by the Global Ads Product & Engineering team. Hundreds of people strong, with a substantial presence in five countries, the Global Ads P&E team is a dynamic and complex organization, operating across a broad spectrum of product and strategic domains.

Design and develop ad serving software using the Go programming language, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability in the system
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers, data scientists, and other engineers, to define requirements and deliver innovative ad tech solutions
Optimize ad delivery algorithms and infrastructure to ensure efficient utilization of resources and minimal latency
Implement and maintain real-time data processing pipelines for ad targeting and user profiling
Build monitoring and analytics tools to track ad performance, user engagement, and system health, providing insights to improve our ad serving capabilities
Lead and mentor junior engineers, fostering a culture of learning and collaboration within the team
Stay updated with the latest developments in ad tech and contribute to the continuous improvement of our systems through research and innovation
Participate in code reviews, architectural discussions, and technical decision-making processes

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field
At least eight years of proven experience as a Software Engineer, with a significant focus on developing ad tech or ad-serving platforms with high-impact

Strong expertise in Go programming language (Golang) and proficiency in concurrent programming
Proven experience with developing ad tech or ad serving platforms with high impact

Experience with distributed systems, microservices architecture, and containerization (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)

CALIFORNIA ONLY

Responsible for the overall product strategy across all Canadian channels: Carriers, National Retail partners and supporting online.  Your essential responsibilities include product selection, positioning and USPs that differentiates Samsung products as well as the creation of local pricing, programs, promotions and the selection of the appropriate sales channels into the marketplace.
Responsible to communicate the value proposition of the products to the sales teams and for developing or localizing the sales tools that support the selling processes and channel programs to enable maximized results. 
Provide the expertise on competition and market conditions, working with the Analytics team and using this knowledge and personal insights to develop the strategy to maximize business.
Manage the Sales Deductions (SD) budget, including monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting and establish the Key Performance Indicator (KPIs) appropriate to the local opportunity.
Provide management and sales teams with required analysis on the Canadian market and accounts to assist Samsung Electronica Canada (SECA) with maximizing opportunities and avoid pitfalls.

Lead and manage teams for special projects that will have an impact on overall SECA MX business.
Develop a Services and Content presence within MX for delivering messaging to partners and internal customers to convey Samsung's strategic DC direction.
Create a Content offering or strategy for clients involving other Samsung devices collaboratively through their stores, via a promotion or with compatible retailers.
Design and localize sales platforms to improve sales and services results (e.g. Trade-In, Samsung Care+).
Design and plan a strategic approach as a solutions based provider for select accounts.
Develops and implements strategies to support Samsung Services (Galaxy AI, Bixby, Samsung Wallet, Members and others to be developed). These programs will be designed with the objective of increasing customer engagement and retention for SECA.
Collaborate closely with the technical team to ensure that the product that is designed and developed delivers to requirements and meets business needs and regulatory requirements and roll-out schedules.
Communicate cross-organizationally with service, customer support, and operations to manage all aspects of new business/product roll-outs, and to understand product or process issues and address concerns.
Oversees project management and execution of divisional and cross-divisional initiatives.
Infrequent travel is required for the role, depending on business need, including travel to the company headquarters in Seoul, South Korea.
Skills and Qualifications
Education:
A degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Computer Science or Engineering. An MBA or post graduate degree in management would be an asset.
Knowledge:
Segment knowledge in the areas of software, technology, mobile devices, mobile payments, mobile applications, wearables, accessories and internet devices.
Well established credentials from having launched technical products ideally in a mature market place.
Client or partner facing experience gained in a marketing, strategy, consulting, sales engineering or business development role, ideally leading teams.
Highly organized with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.
Ability to confidently deal with ambiguity and uncertainty.
Exceptional interpersonal skills, with an emphasis on stakeholder management, negotiation and persuasion, and comfortable working across different cultures.
An aptitude to learn and to innovate in a rapidly changing environment
A self-managed and self-motivated individual not reliant on praise in order to perform at an optimum level.
Exceptional at coaching and mentoring teams and people leaders such that it derives maximum performance.
An ability to deal with conflict and work to a positive outcome.
Experience:
15+ years of team leadership and people management ideally in product marketing or management.
Proven experience in product lifecycle management with a focus on market assessment, competitive analysis and product launch ideally in the technology or telecommunications sectors.
CRITICAL LEADERSHIP CAPABILITIES & BEHAVIORAL ATTRIBUTES:
An assertive, confident take-charge character who operates effectively in an environment where humility is as expected as performance is demanded.
An analytic and systematic thinker.
Innovative, creative and willing to take risks while also adept at long-range objective analysis.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Are you going to enhance the shopping experience of our online customers in the Benelux? And as a digital marketeer, do you want to contribute to increasing market share for our largest division? Then come and join our ambitious and fast-growing Benelux team! We look forward to meeting you!
Role and Responsibilities
Your role
In the role of digital marketeer mobile, you will be responsible for campaign and promotional management, including merchandising activities, working in very close collaboration with the e-commerce product managers mobile. Your goal is to accelerate growth for the mobile product category, executing the sales and marketing plans of the mobile division product group in the market, within the strategy and guidelines of Samsung.
Your responsibilities
Your main responsibility as a digital marketeer (together with the e-commerce team) is driving the vision, development, and measurement of an exceptional shopping experience for Samsung.com in the Benelux.
Besides that, your responsibilities include the following:
Stakeholder management (30%)
Works and communicates efficiently with own team (your direct trade marketing colleagues, the e-commerce marketing specialist, the SEO specialist and manager), other departments (IMD sales & marketing division, corporate marketing (CRM/social/digital teams), logistics, legal, customer service, and finance), and in-house agencies.
E-store mobile sales & marketing campaigns (30%)
Manage and execute the mobile sales & marketing calendar: design, coordinate, and evaluate the mobile campaigns, including, for example, new product launches.
Work closely with paid media specialists, content marketeers, and product managers to optimize traffic and ensure campaigns and promotions are translated into communication for the different owned and paid marketing channels (including data analysis).
E-store mobile performance advertisement (30%)
Lead execution for the performance advertisement activities: cooperate with the paid media team and corporate marketing for the optimal digital media investments (search / shopping / affiliate). Evaluate the investments on a regular basis with the set KPI’s (ROAS).
These performance-based investments should be aligned with the mobile sales & marketing division campaigns. In addition, you are in charge of managing the performance budget within Samsung guidelines.
Customer journey optimization (10%)
Together with the product managers, you are the key driver to improve CVR%. Continuously working on campaign and promotion visibility, initiating small customer experience (CX) improvements and projects towards the CX specialist with the goal to enhance the customer shopping experience and satisfaction.
Own the end-to-end customer journey and drive this at every touchpoint, working closely with different teams in the organization, e.g., content, platform, and UX teams. From product positioning to frequently asked questions, optimize the customer journey from pre-sale to post-sale to ensure a flawless experience.
Your team 
As a digital marketeer mobile, you’ll be joining the e-store team, part of the Samsung Benelux D2C department. With the presence of a lot of talent and expertise, we can make a difference. We do this by working closely together, challenging each other to achieve the best result, and, above all, having fun in what we do. Our team is determined to create the ultimate shopping experience at Samsung.com.
Skills and Qualifications
Your skills and qualifications
Our ideal digital marketeer recognizes themselves in the following profile:
You are a problem solver and work very accurately.
Adept in time- and project management (bring structure in the chaos).
Having a team spirit and being an individual contributor.
Analytical (your mindset and skills).
Resilient (be personally involved but don’t take things personally).
Striving for excellence (premium brand with premium work and output).
Innovative (we move fast and take big risks).
Passionate (we revel in what we do). 
Collaborative (we recognize that we are all in this together).
Preferred qualifications 
As a digital marketeer you have the following qualifications: 
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a similar position within an e-commerce/D2C environment
Bachelor’s degree
You have a good command of the Dutch & English language
You are very strong in stakeholder management
You fit our Samsung DNA: flexible, no 9-5 worker / dynamic

Ability to create dynamic reporting for key measurable and performance tracking

The ability to plan, organize and prioritize multiple and simultaneous projects, issues and activities
The ability to read, interpret, and simplify complex information from various documents to create clarity and ease of understanding
Advanced Excel, SAP, WMS, ERP
Solid understanding of the most up-to-date industry standards and guidelines and be committed to providing the highest level of service to our customers

Ability to communicate in writing, through email, reports, presentations, or orally, product logistics matters to all audiences

Ability to travel 10-25%, sometimes on short notice

Position Summary
Machine Learning Model Engineer – Samsung Ads
Position Summary
Samsung Ads is an advanced advertising technology company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling advertisers to connect audiences from Samsung devices as they are exposed to digital media, using the industry’s most comprehensive data to build the world’s smartest advertising platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business around the world means that we get to work on big, complex projects with stakeholders and teams located around the globe.
 
We are proud to have built a world-class organization grounded in an entrepreneurial and collaborative spirit. Working at Samsung Ads offers one of the best environments in the industry to learn just how fast you can grow, how much you can achieve, and how good you can be. We thrive on problem-solving, breaking new ground, and enjoying every part of the journey.
 
Machine learning lies at the core of the advertising industry, and this is no exception to Samsung Ads. At Samsung Ads, we are actively exploring the latest machine learning techniques to improve our existing systems and products and create new revenue streams. As a machine learning model engineer of the Samsung Ads Platform Intelligence (PI) team, you will have access to unique Samsung proprietary data to develop and deploy a wide spectrum of large-scale machine learning products with real-world impact. You will work closely with and be supported by a talented engineering team and top-notch researchers to work on exciting machine learning projects and state-of-the-art technologies. You will be welcomed by a unique learning culture and creative work atmosphere. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to get deeply involved in envisioning, designing and implementing cutting-edge machine learning products with a fast growing team.
This position will be working on the mobile performance ads product, which is one of the most interesting but challenging machine learning products.
Location: Mountain View and Los Angeles in California, New York City in New York, and Dallas in Texas.
Role and Responsibilities
Responsibilities
A tech lead role to lead and deliver production-grade machine learning products from end to end to make Samsung Ads a key player in the mobile performance ads market.
Design, develop and deploy state-of-the-art and scalable machine learning models to achieve different optimization goals (e.g., app-install optimization, ROAS optimization, retention, etc.).
Research the latest machine learning technologies and keep up-to-date with industry trends and developments.
Analyze complex problems with massive advertising data, identify gaps, and propose and execute technical proposals.
Create prototypes of new ML-based solutions quickly and put them into production.
Closely work with different internal ML teams (e.g., ML platform, ML serving, and MLOps teams) to improve our codebase and product health.
Closely work with cross-functional partner teams in global settings to deliver new ML features and solutions and achieve business objectives.
Mentor junior engineers and provide technical guidance.
Learn quickly and adapt to a fast-paced working environment.
Experience Requirements:
Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science or related fields (e.g., Mathematics).
5+ years of industry experience with a Master’s degree or 3+ years of industry experience with a PhD degree.
Solid theoretical background in machine learning and/or data mining.
Proficiency in mainstream ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark ML, etc.).
Hands-on experience with production-grade machine learning solutions.
Experience with mainstream big data tools (e.g., MapReduce, Spark, Flink, Kafka, etc.).
Extensive programming experience in Python, Go or other OOP languages.
Familiarity with data structures, algorithms and software engineering principles.
Proficiency in SQL and databases.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to drive cross-functional partnerships.
Skills and Qualifications
Preferred Experience Requirements:
Publications in top relevant venues (e.g., TPAMI, NeurIPS, ICML, ICLR, KDD, WWW, SIGIR, AAAI, IJCAI, etc.).
Basic knowledge about Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Experience with the advertising industry and real-time bidding (RTB) ecosystem.
CALIFORNIA ONLY
Compensation for this role is expected to be between $240,000 and $280,000. Actual pay will be determined considering factors such as relevant skills and experience, and comparison to other employees in the role.

Why join our team?
Joining our TV product management team offers an exciting opportunity to be at the forefront of innovation in the consumer electronics industry. You’ll have the chance to work with cutting edge technology and shape the future of television experience. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with a diverse range of colleagues and partners, expanding your network and skill set. With the potential to take full ownership of areas within the TV category and drive sustainable growth for Samsung, joining our team promises both professional development and personal fulfilment.

Key Responsibilities
Creates and implements product marketing plans for a TV category to meet critical metrics
Develops go-to-market strategies, including pricing, distribution, product mix, and promotional recommendations
Lineup management
 – directly manage a specific TV  product segment, including lineup optimization and initiatives targeted at driving operational efficiency or responding to market challenges
Price administration

Sales and P&L Analysis

Forecasting and Inventory Monitoring and Optimization

Tracks weekly product sales data by account and by SKU to manage forecasts and resolve sales challenges (e.g., recommends pricing adjustments, suggests removal of product from floor, provides retailers with data-driven recommendations on which models to promote)
Collaborates with sales teams and customers to understand customer retailer strategies and challenges, and in general to provide the marketing support needed for successful selling
Conducts sales and supply chain meetings, develops weekly forecasts, and confirms the sales estimates essential for achieving supply chain efficiency and appropriate inventory levels
Works with Training team to create training material for sales associates
Pitches product line-up features and strategy at key customer meetings and events
Conducts competitive market analysis using various systems as well as online research

What we need for this role
To be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:
Experience: Product Management or relevant experience in the consumer electronics industry.
Communication: Build relationships across businesses and cultures. Understanding requests and handling multiple partners. Confident and comfortable in presenting to senior partners or large groups
Innovation: Challenge ways of thinking, generating creative perspectives and establishing new, effective ways of working. Identifying future trends and how to use these for business success
Problem Solving: Seek and identify root causes or problems, establishing appropriate solutions and tracking results to conclusion
Eye For Business: Understand the product and organisation structure; Analysing industry trends and competitors to create business opportunities

Position Summary
As our Head of CRM & Loyalty, you will play a pivotal role in leading and overseeing our customer relationship management and loyalty programs. You will create, manage, and execute all CRM and loyalty initiatives across various departments, including sales, e-store, and headquarters for the Benelux region. You will have a comprehensive view, can mix and match requests with the customer in mind, and will be responsible for shaping the strategic direction, development, and execution of high-impact CRM and loyalty programs that drive customer retention and engagement. You have in-depth knowledge of CRM systems, loyalty programs, data analytics, and customer experience management, love stakeholder management, and have experience with leading a team. Do you have what it takes to lead our innovative team? Build the future and apply now.
Role and Responsibilities
Your role
In this role, you will be responsible for the overarching strategy and performance of all CRM and loyalty initiatives. This includes oversight of strategy development, execution, analysis, budget management, and continuous improvement. You will ensure the optimum use of resources and strategies within the company’s guidelines, enhancing customer loyalty and achieving business objectives.
Your responsibilities
As our Head of CRM & Loyalty, you will lead the CRM & Loyalty team and manage the end-to-end process of CRM and loyalty initiatives. Your key responsibilities include:
Strategy and Leadership:
Develop and implement a cohesive CRM and loyalty strategy that aligns with overall business goals and objectives.
Provide leadership and direction to the CRM & Loyalty team, ensuring the successful planning, execution, and measurement of initiatives across all channels.
Oversee all aspects of CRM and loyalty planning, including customer segmentation, data analysis, personalization strategies, budgeting, and timeline management.
Program Development and Execution:
Lead the development and execution of CRM and loyalty programs, ensuring seamless integration with other marketing efforts.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure cohesive program development and implementation.
Innovate and optimize CRM and loyalty programs to enhance customer engagement, satisfaction, and retention.
Performance Focus, Reporting & Analysis:
Drive all CRM and loyalty activities to enhance customer engagement, brand loyalty, and business results.
Establish and communicate a clear mission and vision for CRM and loyalty efforts aligned with company guidelines.
Consistently generate and review comprehensive reports by analyzing performance data. Provide actionable insights and present strategic plans to internal and external stakeholders.
Budget Management:
Oversee the CRM & loyalty budget, ensuring optimal allocation of resources to maximize ROI. Collaborate with finance and procurement teams to monitor expenditures, optimize budget usage, and adjust strategies as necessary.
Process Improvement and Change Management:

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Why join our team?
With the fast changing trends in consumer behaviour towards shopping online and purchasing directly from manufacturers, Samsung has made growing its Direct to Consumer (D2C) business one of its global strategic priorities.
This role is a unique opportunity to design the next phase of our D2C growth. As our Senior Manager of Strategy, you will work closely with our D2C Commercial, Marketing and Development teams to identify future growth opportunities, and map out the strategy required to achieve both our Customer and Commercial Objectives. You will also work closely with our Product Divisions to understand their ambitions and challenges, to ensure D2C can support their objectives through data and insight.
With our D2C business continuing to grow quickly, this is an exciting time to join the team and work in a dynamic, ever-changing environment.
Role and Responsibilities
What will this role achieve?
Monitor key competitor proposition developments; benchmarking vs our own proposition
Evaluate D2C best-practice initiatives from other Samsung Subsidiaries, adapting for UK market
Monitor Ecommerce & Consumer Electronics market trends and performance
Develop D2C Strategy to drive profitable growth; achieving Customer & Commercial critical metrics
Lead multi-functional SEUK D2C Shop App Taskforce (T/F), to increase adoption and usage of App.
Market, Competitor & Consumer Insight
Monitor key competitor developments and conduct regular benchmarking of the Samsung D2C proposition to identify points of difference and improvement opportunities.
Identify D2C best practice and emerging trends in consumer electronics and other product verticals; building into SEUK D2C strategy and approach as required.
Build a deep understanding of our consumer needs, sharing with other D2C teams to factor into their planning and execution.
D2C Global Best-Practice Adaptation & Implementation
Summarize SEUK Activities to develop best practice examples across Proposition Development, Marketing and Onsite Execution; share as required with Global GMO team for global adoption
Work with Global GMO team to understand D2C best practice cases developed by other Global Samsung Subsidiaries; to evaluate performance through lens of UK Market & Consumer dynamics.
Use Global Best Practice cases to develop SEUK D2C Pilot activities for implementation. Work with D2C LT and teams to seek approval for adoption and execution of Pilot activities.
Collaboration across Product Divisions
Work closely with Product Divisions to understand market trends and market-share data, to develop deep understanding of Mobile, Domestic Appliance and TVAV priorities and challenges.
Incorporate divisional priorities into overarching D2C Strategy; developing activities and pilots for adoption by D2C Commercial, Marketing and Onsite teams to enhance Premium Sales and Profitability.
Collate, summarize and share results from pilot activities, to evolve and improve execution for future roll-out and expansion.
D2C Strategy Development
Work closely with UK DTC Leadership Team to understand overarching D2C objectives and strategic critical metrics for SEUK and Global D2C teams.
Collaborate with UK DTC LT to develop overall D2C Growth Strategy and longer term direction for SEUK.
Develop Strategic principles, objectives, critical metrics and plans to guide SEUK D2C growth, to achieve both customer and commercial objectives.
Work alongside Commercial, Marketing, Onsite and Development teams to develop Milestone and Project plans for key D2C activities; ensuring clear communication and alignment across teams.
Strategy Development to focus on the following key areas for SEUK DTC:
i) Premium Up-sell: Enhancing our ability to upsell visitors into our Premium SKUs across our Divisions (MX / CE), through optimization of proposition, messaging and customer journey.
ii) Ecosystem Attach: Increasing the portion of customers that buy Ecosystem Products (i.e.. TV + Soundbar, Mobile Phone + Buds); at point of purchase, or during post purchase experience.
iii) Existing Customer Retention: Developing our strategy to increase DTC Customer Lifetime Value through increasing frequency of upgrade and cross-selling into other categories / divisions.
iv) Early Upgrades: Pulling forward the upgrade decision for our customers, in order to increase lifetime value and Premium Market Share.
v) Shop App Development: Developing the Strategy to enhance the Shop App platform, in order to acquire additional customers, and better retain our existing customers, through developing improved App native functionality vs the mobile-web / desktop experience.
Shop App Taskforce Leadership
Manage Shop App Manager, supporting them to lead the Samsung Shop App T/F; with key objectives to increase downloads, engagement and conversion to sales; generating incremental revenue for DTC.
Support Shop App Manager to develop a clear roadmap of activities to increase Shop App adoption, working alongside GMO and EO teams to enhance the customer journey and native user experience offered by Shop App.
Collaborate with PMO, Regional and Global App Taskforce teams to prioritize planning and delivery of new initiatives; identify ways to rapidly bring new concepts to market through ‘test & learn’.
Track and monitor performance through implementation to benefits realization.
People & Culture
Contribute fully to the DTC team culture – that delivers on our targets, celebrates success and has fun whilst doing it.

Development of D2C Strategy, critical metrics, timings, aligned with SEUK Leadership Team
Development of Pilot proposals for SEUK D2C, based on global best practise cases
Through D2C Strategy, enable SEUK D2C to achieve commercial sales targets (Revenue, Profit, Budget Efficiency) and Customer critical metrics (Retention Share, LTV, Purchase Frequency)

Demonstrable experience in strategy development and planning

Machine learning lies at the core of the advertising industry, and this is no exception to Samsung Ads. At Samsung Ads, we actively explore the latest machine-learning techniques to improve our existing systems and products and create new revenue streams. As a machine learning model engineer of the Samsung Ads Platform Intelligence (PI) team, you will have access to unique Samsung proprietary data to develop and deploy a wide spectrum of large-scale machine learning products with real-world impact. You will work closely with and be supported by a talented engineering team and top-notch researchers to work on exciting machine learning projects and state-of-the-art technologies. You will be welcomed by a unique learning culture and creative work atmosphere. This is an exciting and unique opportunity to get deeply involved in envisioning, designing, and implementing cutting-edge machine learning products with a fast-growing team.

mobile performance ads
 product, one of the most interesting but challenging machine learning products.

 Mountain View, CA

A tech lead role to lead and deliver production-grade machine learning products from end to end to make Samsung Ads a key player in the mobile performance ads market.
Design, develop, and deploy state-of-the-art and scalable machine learning models to achieve different optimization goals (e.g., app-install optimization, ROAS optimization, retention, etc.).
Research the latest machine learning technologies and keep up-to-date with industry trends and developments.
Analyze complex problems with massive advertising data, identify gaps, and propose and execute technical proposals.
Create prototypes of new ML-based solutions quickly and put them into production.
Closely work with internal ML teams (e.g., ML platform, ML serving, and MLOps teams) to improve our codebase and product health.

Learn quickly and adapt to a fast-paced working environment.

Master’s or PhD degree in Computer Science or related fields.
7+ years of industry experience with a Master’s degree or 5+ years of industry experience with a PhD degree.
Solid theoretical background in machine learning and data mining.
Proficiency in mainstream ML libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Spark ML, etc.).
Hands-on experience with production-grade machine learning solutions.
Experience with mainstream big data tools (e.g., MapReduce, Spark, Flink, Kafka, etc.).
Extensive programming experience in Python, Go, or other OOP languages.

Samsung, a world leader in advanced semiconductor technology, is founded on a simple philosophy – the endless pursuit of excellence will create a better world for all. Come build with us!
Role and Responsibilities
You will join our growing Global Advanced Technology Enablement team that is specialized in driving technology development across Samsung System LSI business. We engage with Foundry partners from the very early phase to thoroughly explore target technology for next-generation SoC products.
As a highly experienced DTCO engineer, you will help propel Samsung SARC/ACL’s innovation forward by building highly efficient design flows for DTCO. With strong expertise in PnR design flow and large-design space exploration, you will drive collaboration with the GPU development team to ensure design changes are consumable throughout the product development cycle.
You are an innovator. You are skilled at developing CAD flows for custom design on aggressive GPU designs with a high level of automation for DTCO needs.
You have a curious mindset and thrive on navigating the unknown through innovation and continuous learning. You will explore a methodology to achieve low-power and high-performance goals for Samsung-specific SOC design styles.
You have expertise in one or many technical areas, including concepts of logic/physical synthesis, power estimation, and standard cell design.
You are a problem solver. You enjoy solving CAD and design methodology-related challenges.   
You thrive in a production and result-oriented environment, working on high-impact, large-scale projects that have a global impact.  
You are skilled at working effectively with various stakeholders by using clear and precise communication skills for technical requirements and specifications, while proactively driving collaboration with cross-functional teams.
You are detail-oriented. You can provide and maintain thorough documentation, publish results, and fulfill other project management-related needs.

10+ years of experience with a Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science/Engineering, or 8+ years of experience with a Master’s Degree, or 6+ years of experience with a Ph.D.
5+ years of custom design tools and methodology development experience

Experience with scripting/programming languages like Tcl, Perl, C/C++.

jobPostingInfo.jobDescription:
Position Summary
Why join our team?
Our European Consumer & Market Insights (CMI) team collaborates with a broad range of business partners with a vision to operate as Business Insight Leaders.
Our mission is to bring consumer and market insight to the centre of the business, supporting colleagues to make better decisions that to grow the brand, market share, and overall marketing excellence!
Role and Responsibilities
Your key responsibilities
Be the category champion for the Visual Display (VD) category, generating insights to support sales, marketing, and product strategies, taking particular ownership of Monitor insights and supporting with insights for other audio-visual products including TVs, Projectors, Soundbars and Speakers, and related services
Work alongside CMI colleagues who manage Digital Appliance Category Insights, developing a single view of the consumer, the home, and opportunities for Samsung
Collaborate with CMI colleagues in the Marketing Intelligence & Insight Strategy team who manage secondary sources and digital listening, ensuring that category insights draw on this intelligence
Collaborate with colleagues across the organisation to draw on all relevant insights and build stronger and more impactful recommendations
Ensure VD requirements and implications are considered in CMI projects and programmes, e.g. Marketing Activity Monitor, GfK Consumer Intelligence
Partner with local markets across Europe to help craft multi-country projects and ensure insights are relevant for the local market requirements
Work with agencies to develop deliverables, ensuring these have clear business implications and concrete recommendations, and are tailored to maximise impact for different collaborators
Analyse data (using analytics tools) to support key business questions
Support Samsung build a strong Multi Device Experience / SmartThings proposition for consumers, providing a VD perspective on the opportunities in this space
Continually and proactively identify and communicate key issues, trends and developments relevant to VD, to the business, highlighting implications and opportunities
Raising the profile of VD insights and the CMI team by expanding your network beyond immediate partners and sharing insights and recommendations in a tailored way
Skills and Qualifications

To be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:
Essential:
A genuine passion and curiosity for understanding what makes consumers and customers “tick” and encouraging others to do the same
Strong project management and time management skills, planning ahead and laying out clear goal posts for project deliveries
Strong data synthesis and interpretation skills – bringing together data from multiple data sources (quantitative, qualitative, continuous, ad-hoc) in order to create powerful insights
Excellent storytelling skills, ensuring recommendations cut through with colleagues
Strong presentation skills, delivering compelling presentations to senior executives and non-data-savvy partners
Strong networking skills whilst speaking to colleagues across the business to influence decision-making
Collaboration and teamwork skills, with the ability to partner with colleagues within CMI and beyond to deliver real impact

Proven understanding of shopper journey projects and embedding them into the business. Emphasis on the lower end of the funnel (retail – both on and offline)
Experience working with social and digital listening platforms, and using these tools to create actionable insights
Knowledge of working in or with service related projects, e.g. those relating to TV services or gaming services

Ability to work on B2C as well as B2B insights projects

Promoting insight-led marketing excellence, collaboration and partnership and being perceived as a trusted business partner

Position Summary
Samsung Ads is an advanced advertising technology company in rapid growth that focuses on enabling brands to connect with Samsung TV audiences as they are exposed to digital media by using the industry’s most comprehensive data to build the world’s smartest advertising platform. Being part of an international company such as Samsung and doing business worldwide means that we get to work on the most challenging projects with stakeholders and teams around the globe.

This is a high-level analytical operational role; the person will lead our efforts to manage stock, forecasting and allocations across multiple accounts. It is a key operational role in the Ireland Sales Operations and Supply Chain Department working across multiple accounts for the MX business. 
The successful candidate will be comfortable customer facing with multiple external customers attending and presenting at monthly alignment meetings and quarterly business reviews to ensure the smooth running of the department. You will be working closely with internal team members, senior management and established processes to achieve key performance indicators. 
The person will deliver sales reports, demand forecasts, allocation/RTF placement, finite stock planning for multiple customers while supporting divisional sales teams and UK&I supply chain internal departments with a focus on customer facing commercial support.
If you want the opportunity to work in a dynamic environment with experienced supply chain managers, demand planners and supply chain specialists who manage all operational and supply chain activities for the MX division. Then this is the role for you!
Role and Responsibilities
Your key responsibilities
Have an analytical overview preparing sales projections, CPFR report presentations, and channel PSI management including analyses of variances vs. sales forecasts across multiple accounts.
Analytical support for senior management regarding operational allocations across multiple accounts.
Present analytical data at customer monthly alignment meetings and quarterly business reviews, face to face where possible.
Working cross functionally with all divisional leaders and teams with a focus on customer facing support for the commercial team.
Manage forecasting systems, provide accurate and timely data, sales projections and demand management reports
Managing all aspects of sales operational supply allocations for product and flagship launches and through times of supply issues for the Irish Market.
Analytical planning and sales projection reporting - Supports periodic sales revenue target setting (customer tier reports)
Report on key data points for quarterly sales harmonisation process. Weeks of stock, forecast accuracy, starting and ending stock positions.
Ensure new products are available on time and EOL products are transitioned to remove from channel inventory.
Collaborate with sales, IT and finance to develop, create and maintain accurate reporting to business leaders.
In charge of the weekly stock report including stock level, aged stock, run-rate and weeks of stock management.
Responsible for purchase order management for your allocated business function.
Provide forecast updates aligned to promotion plans.
Process deliveries with third-party logistic providers.
Deliver performance review with carriers.
Order Management & Data Entry.
Competent in supply chain account management – responsible for all elements of accounts - customers forecast, orders, stock and sales, inventory status and credit limit.
Manage weekly collaborative, planning, forecasting and replenishment conference calls with customers.
Participate in weekly sell-in/sell-out planning with sales team.
Analyse customers’ sales and inventory to manage weeks of stock to company Key Performance Indicator level.
Monitor channel information and utilise all information to work with Account Managers to avoid creating unnecessary stock buffers.
Resolve supply issues with Head Office team / monitoring SKU codes and product availability.
Work with product team on key product launches
Participate in internal and external meetings, sharing ideas, taking action & leading supply chain activities.
Keeping up-to date with market trends for example: products, competitors and marketing.
What we need for this role
To be successful, you will possess the following skills and attributes:
Shown experience in supply chain management or logistics.
Excellent understanding of supply chain procedures.
Demonstrate strong analytical skills.
Strong IT/systems skills including Excel skills.
Experienced in leading internal communications and working cross functionally to deliver results.
Collaborative approach and a willingness to learn.
Excellent interpersonal skills and a teammate.
High level of attention to detail and strong organisational skills.
Ability to work to own initiative, self-motivated, and self-confident.
Adapt quickly to ever-changing situations.
Ability to communicate effectively with a variety of Partners and Subcontractors.
Ability to work under extreme pressure with tight timeframes;
High Standard of English Literacy (written and spoken).
Experience in processing/manipulating/reporting on large amounts of data.

Position Summary
Are you ready to lead and oversee all our marketing campaigns as our Senior Campaign Manager? As our Senior Campaign Manager you will create, manage and execute all campaigns from sales departments, e-store, EHQ and HQ for the Benelux. With your exceptional ability to maintain a helicopter view, you can mix and match requests with the customer in mind. You will be responsible for shaping the strategic direction, development, and execution of high-impact campaigns that drive brand growth and engagement, together with your team. 
Your profound expertise in CRM, Loyalty, Media, Advertising, PR, Social, and Influencer Marketing sets you apart. Your passion for stakeholder management and proven experience in leading high-performing teams will be key to your success. Do you have what it takes? Build the future and apply now.
Role and Responsibilities
Your role
In this role, you will be responsible for the overarching strategy and performance of all marketing campaigns. This includes oversight of Campaign Planning, Execution, Analysis, Strategy, Budget Management, and Go-To-Market initiatives. You will ensure the optimum use of resources and marketing mix within the company’s strategy and guidelines, enhancing brand awareness and achieving business objectives.
Your responsibilities
As our Senior Campaign Manager you will lead the campaign team and manage the end-to-end process of campaign initiatives. Your key responsibilities include:
Campaign Strategy and Leadership:
Develop and implement a cohesive campaign strategy that aligns with overall business goals and objectives.
Provide leadership and direction to the campaign team, ensuring the successful planning, execution, and measurement of marketing campaigns across all channels.
Oversee all aspects of campaign planning, including market and audience research, competitor analysis, positioning, messaging, budgeting, and timeline management for all our channel teams: CRM & Loyalty, Media & advertising, Social & Influencers and PR & Comms.
Go-To-Market:
Lead the go-to-market strategy and process for major campaign launches. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless launch operations and effective information distribution.
Coordinate with senior management and key stakeholders to secure buy-in and alignment on campaign strategies and objectives.
Performance Focus, Reporting & Analysis:
Drive all campaign activities to enhance engagement, brand recognition, and business results. Establish and communicate a clear mission and vision for campaign efforts aligned with company guidelines.
Consistently generate and review comprehensive campaign reports by analyzing performance data (from first and 3rd party sources). Provide actionable insights and present strategic and marketing plans to internal and external stakeholders.
Budget Management:
Oversee the campaign budget, ensuring optimal allocation of resources to maximize ROI. Collaborate with finance and procurement teams to monitor expenditures, optimize budget usage, and adjust strategies as necessary.
Process Improvement and Change Management:
Maintain a helicopter view to oversee multiple campaigns and ensure alignment with overall business objectives.
Continuously evaluate and improve campaign processes to enhance efficiency and effectiveness.
Lead change management initiatives to adapt to a fast-paced environment, ensuring smooth transitions and stakeholder buy-in.
Team Development and Internal Communication:
Build and develop a high-performing campaign team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
Efficiently collaborate and communicate with various departments including Sales, Marcom, Product, SCM, Channel, and cross-functional teams (Legal, Customer Service, Corporate Marketing). Maintain strong reporting lines with Senior Management and Headquarters.
Skills and Qualifications
Your skills and qualifications
Our ideal Senior Campaign Manager meets the following criteria:
Over 10 years of experience in a senior marketing role, with a proven track record of several years in campaign management and leadership.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).
Fluency in Dutch and English.
Proven ability to manage multiple campaigns in a fast-paced environment.
Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to interpret data and market insights to drive informed decisions.
Exceptional communication, presentation, and leadership skills to effectively collaborate with and inspire internal and external stakeholders.
Strong project management skills and a proactive, results-driven attitude.
Experience in change management and process improvement.
A passion for marketing, innovation, and staying up-to-date with industry trends.

 Profile

 recognize themselves in the following profile:

Position Summary
We are looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join our team in Staines-upon-Thames. You will be experienced in working with data, curious about data and patterns, passionate to turn huge data sets into accurate and meaningful information which is easy to understand and has commercial impact on Samsung products.
Role and Responsibilities
As a data scientist your role will involve:
Developing a deep understanding of data to provide meaningful insights with significant business impact.
Work as part of a team to deliver complex solutions tailored to commercial and research interests.
Tackling all stages of data science workflows, from EDA, design and preparation, through to delivery, deployment and maintenance.
Freedom to launch new projects (academic or commercial) within Samsung Research, in collaboration with other teams or industry/university partners.
Skills and Qualifications
Required Skills
PhD, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, ML & Artificial Intelligence, etc.)
Programming proficiency in Python
Data collection, data fusion, statistical data modelling and evaluation experience in Python
Prior experience with fundamental modelling techniques such as: regression, clustering, classification, decision trees, statistical models
Knowledge of and experience deploying modern machine learning techniques to solve real world problems
Excellent communication, team work and a results-oriented attitude
Proficiency in problem solving and a self-starter

Knowledge of big data tools such as Spark, Hadoop etc.
Familiar with cloud technologies (AWS, Azure, etc.)
Experience deploying models via MLOps platforms (Neptune, MLFlow, Sagemaker etc.)
Exposure to deep learning approaches and modelling frameworks (PyTorch, Tensorflow, Keras, etc.)

Permanent

 Staines-upon-Thames, Surrey, UK

 Standard working week will be 3 days onsite and 2 days working from home if preferred

 Competitive Salary, Annual Performance Bonus up to 21.5%, Pension Scheme with company contribution up to 8.5%, Income Protection, Stocks & Shares ISA, Life Assurance, 25 days holiday (increasing to 30 with length of service).
